intro: Adenocalymma alliaceum, commonly known as the garlic leaf adenocalymma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic, garlic-scented leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the Rutaceae family. Its leaves are narrow and strap-like, often emitting a strong, pungent odor when crushed. Adenocalymma alliaceum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and fragrance.
